sentiment_score_definition: x <= -0.35: Bearish; -0.35 < x <= -0.15: Somewhat-Bearish; -0.15 < x < 0.15: Neutral; 0.15 <= x < 0.35: Somewhat_Bullish; x >= 0.35: Bullish
relevance_score_definition: 0 < x <= 1, with a higher score indicating higher relevance.

feed.title: Precision Trading with Core Scientific Inc. Tranche 2 Warrants (CORZZ) Risk Zones

feed.title: Wall Street Sees More Than 69% Upside for Core Scientific Inc. (CORZ)
feed.summary: Analysts project a significant upside for Core Scientific Inc. (CORZ), with price targets suggesting over 69% growth despite a recent stock decline. The positive outlook is driven by the company's strong growth prospects in high-performance computing (HPC) and its strategic position to meet accelerating demand amidst power constraints. Core Scientific is expected to report improved financial results for Q4 2025, with a forecast of $108.48 million in revenue and a negative $0.14 GAAP EPS.

feed.title: Citizens Upgrades Core Scientific (CORZ) as HPC Growth Outlook Strengthens
feed.summary: Citizens has upgraded Core Scientific (CORZ) from Market Perform to "Market Outperform" with a $30 price target, citing robust growth prospects in High-Performance Computing (HPC). The firm believes Core Scientific's strong power pipeline will secure additional HPC lease agreements, positioning it favorably amidst booming demand and competitor constraints. Analysts note that despite a failed merger with CoreWeave, Core Scientific is securing more favorable contract terms with AI firms, reinforcing its "undervalued" status as it transitions into an AI business.

feed.title: Citizens Upgrades Core Scientific (CORZ) as HPC Growth Outlook Strengthens
feed.summary: Citizens has upgraded Core Scientific (CORZ) from Market Perform to Market Outperform, setting a price target of $30.00, citing strong growth prospects in high-performance computing (HPC). Despite a failed merger, analysts believe Core Scientific is well-positioned to secure favorable contracts due to its robust power pipeline. The firm views CORZ as undervalued, acknowledging its transformation into an AI business.

feed.title: Core Scientific’s Potential Surge and Industry Influence
feed.summary: Core Scientific Inc. (CORZ) stocks traded up by 6.97% following a significant mining equipment upgrade and a stock upgrade to "Outperform." The company's financial health shows challenges with revenue decline but strong debt management and operating profitability. Global regulatory changes in crypto and sustainable tech initiatives are also influencing its strategic outlook and market perception.

feed.title: Core Scientific (CORZ) Gets 7.3% Boost from ‘Buy’ Reco
feed.summary: Core Scientific Inc. (NASDAQ:CORZ) saw its stock jump 7.30% after investment firm Citizens issued a "buy" recommendation and a $30 price target, representing a 106% upside potential. The upgrade reflects confidence in the company's growth prospects for 2026, particularly its pipeline for high-performance computing leasing agreements beyond CoreWeave. Despite previous merger termination with CoreWeave, Core Scientific improved its third-quarter net loss by 68%.

feed.title: Is Core Scientific Soaring or Stumbling?​
feed.summary: Core Scientific Inc. (NASDAQ: CORZ) stock is up by 6.89%, influenced by new Japanese cryptocurrency regulations requiring substantial reserves and the merger of Blockfusion and Blue Acquisition Corp. The company's financial data shows mixed results with significant debt, negative equity, and a negative net income, despite a revenue of $510.67M. Analysts are debating CORZ's trajectory amidst these financial and competitive changes.

feed.title: Core Scientific upgraded to Outperform from Market Perform at Citizens
feed.summary: Citizens analyst Greg Miller upgraded Core Scientific (CORZ) to Outperform from Market Perform, setting a $30 price target. The upgrade is attributed to the company's strong growth prospects and its ability to secure additional high-performance compute lease agreements beyond CoreWeave. This strategic positioning is expected to allow Core Scientific to capitalize on the increasing demand for HPC infrastructure.

feed.title: Core Scientific (CORZ) Stock Drops on Dec. 15, 2025: Latest News, Analyst Price Targets, and What Investors Are Watching
feed.summary: Core Scientific (CORZ) stock dropped sharply on December 15, 2025, as investors reassessed risk in crypto- and AI-infrastructure-linked companies. The company is actively transitioning from primarily a bitcoin miner to a digital infrastructure and high-density colocation platform, leveraging its power and data center capacity for AI and HPC workloads. Despite the recent merger with CoreWeave falling through, Core Scientific's commercial relationship with CoreWeave remains significant, and analysts have mixed but generally bullish outlooks, reflecting the ongoing strategic shift.

feed.title: Bernstein Raises the PT on Core Scientific (CORZ), Assigns a Buy Rating
feed.summary: Bernstein has increased its price target for Core Scientific (CORZ) from $17 to $24, maintaining a Buy rating, due to the growing importance of bitcoin miners in the AI value chain. Core Scientific offers energy-powered spaces suitable for AI data centers. This follows Core Scientific's rejection of a merger with CoreWeave, with analysts suggesting shareholders believe the company's value is higher given current comparable valuations.

feed.title: CoreWeave CEO won't say if Core Scientific caused data center delays, both stocks plunge
feed.summary: CoreWeave's shares fell by 16% after CEO Mike Intrator discussed delays at a third-party data center developer, which impacted the company's full-year guidance. During the discussion, Intrator avoided confirming whether Core Scientific was the third-party provider, despite CNBC's Jim Cramer's suggestions linking the delays to Core Scientific sites in various states. Core Scientific, which CoreWeave previously attempted to acquire, also saw its shares drop by 10%.

feed.title: Core Scientific shareholders reject $9 billion CoreWeave offer, deal terminated
feed.summary: Core Scientific shareholders have rejected a $9 billion all-stock acquisition offer from CoreWeave, leading to the termination of the deal. This marks the second time CoreWeave's attempt to acquire Core Scientific has been foiled, with investors citing concerns about the sale process, deal structure, and valuation, particularly in light of soaring valuations for AI-related companies. Despite Core Scientific's board recommending the sale, shareholders opted for the company to continue as a standalone entity.

feed.title: Core Scientific Announces Termination of Merger Agreement with CoreWeave
feed.summary: Core Scientific, Inc. announced the termination of its merger agreement with CoreWeave, effective immediately, after not receiving the necessary stockholder votes for approval. Core Scientific will remain a publicly traded company, with its common stock continuing to trade on Nasdaq under the symbol CORZ. The company is a leader in digital infrastructure for high-density colocation services and digital asset mining, and is converting facilities to support AI-related workloads and next-generation colocation services.

feed.title: Core Scientific Announces Preliminary Results of Special Meeting of Stockholders
feed.summary: Core Scientific, Inc. announced that it did not receive the requisite stockholder votes to approve its merger agreement with CoreWeave, Inc. The final voting results will be detailed in a Form 8-K filing with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission. Core Scientific specializes in digital infrastructure for high-density colocation services and digital asset mining, with plans to convert facilities for AI-related workloads.

feed.title: Core Scientific Announces Fiscal Third Quarter 2025 Results
feed.summary: Core Scientific (NASDAQ: CORZ) announced its fiscal third quarter 2025 financial results, reporting total revenue of $81.1 million, down from $95.4 million in Q3 2024. The company's net loss improved to $146.7 million from $455.3 million in the prior year, primarily due to a lower GAAP non-cash fair value adjustment. Core Scientific also provided an update on its pending all-stock merger transaction with CoreWeave, which is subject to stockholder approval on October 30, 2025.

feed.title: Two Seas Capital Highlights Significant Value Upside for Core Scientific Shareholders If They Reject the Proposed Sale to CoreWeave - The Malaysian Reserve
feed.summary: Two Seas Capital is urging Core Scientific shareholders to reject the proposed sale to CoreWeave, citing significant value upside if they retain ownership. The firm believes Core Scientific's intrinsic value considerably exceeds the offer price. They argue that the company's strong financial position and market trends offer a more favorable outcome for shareholders without the sale.

feed.title: A $5 billion deal key to CoreWeave's AI empire just lost another investor's support - Business Insider
feed.summary: A $5 billion deal for CoreWeave to acquire Core Scientific is facing increasing opposition from shareholders, casting doubt on one of the year's largest data center mergers. Gullane Capital and Two Seas Capital, both significant shareholders in Core Scientific, argue that the offer undervalues the company, especially after a dip in CoreWeave's stock price. CoreWeave's CEO, Michael Intrator, maintains the acquisition is the "most compelling path forward" and its "best and final" offer.

feed.title: [DFAN14A] Core Scientific, Inc./tx SEC Filing - Stock Titan
feed.summary: Two Seas Capital, a major shareholder of Core Scientific (CORZ), has filed definitive additional proxy materials urging shareholders to vote against the proposed sale to CoreWeave. Two Seas argues the deal substantially undervalues Core Scientific, citing an implied value of about $17.50 per share compared to current market performance and peer valuations. The firm emphasizes that Core Scientific's stock has traded above the implied deal value for 44 straight trading days and suggests greater standalone upside for the company.

feed.title: Mixed options sentiment in Core Scientific, Inc with shares down 3.38%
feed.summary: Core Scientific, Inc. (CORZ) is experiencing mixed options sentiment, with its shares currently down 3.38%. Options trading activity is significantly above average, showing a strong preference for calls over puts, and implied volatility remains high. The company is set to report earnings soon, and option markets are factoring in a 50% probability of a significant price movement.

feed.title: CoreWeave: 3 Reasons The Core Scientific Acquisition Is Mutually Destructive (NASDAQ:CRWV) - Seeking Alpha
feed.summary: Core Scientific, Inc. investors are facing a critical vote on an acquisition offer from CoreWeave, Inc. later this month. While CoreWeave's bid offers a significant premium over Core Scientific's pre-disclosure market value, this article argues that the transaction carries immediate downside risks that outweigh potential benefits for both sets of investors. CoreWeave has already seen an 11% decline in value since announcing the proposed acquisition of Core Scientific.

feed.title: Two Seas Capital Highlights Significant Value Upside for Core Scientific Shareholders If They Reject the Proposed Sale to CoreWeave - PR Newswire
feed.summary: Two Seas Capital is urging Core Scientific (NASDAQ: CORZ) shareholders to reject the proposed sale to CoreWeave (NASDAQ: CRWV), arguing that the transaction significantly undervalues Core Scientific. The firm presented market evidence showing that Core Scientific's stock has lagged behind peers in the AI infrastructure boom due to its tethering to CoreWeave's declining stock, and believes shareholders can achieve greater upside by rejecting the current deal. Two Seas Capital, a major shareholder, encourages a vote AGAINST the proposed transaction using the GOLD proxy card.

feed.title: Form 425 Core Scientific, Inc./tx Filed by: CoreWeave, Inc. - StreetInsider
feed.summary: CoreWeave, Inc. filed a Form 425 with the SEC related to its proposed acquisition of Core Scientific, Inc. The filing includes communications posted on LinkedIn by CoreWeave and its CEO regarding the October 16, 2025 press release about the acquisition. It also provides important information about SEC filings, participant solicitations, and forward-looking statements concerning the transaction.
